cards.title: Forces and Resultants
details: Identify and represent forces using force diagrams
Find components and resultants of forces

cards.title: Equilibrium of Particles
details: Apply the conditions for equilibrium (sum of forces zero)
Resolve forces and use triangle of forces
Model contact forces (normal and frictional components), understand smooth and rough contacts

cards.title: Friction and Newton’s Third Law
details: Understand limiting friction and coefficient of friction
Apply limiting equilibrium concepts
Apply Newton’s third law to interactions

cards.title: Displacement, Velocity, Acceleration
details: Understand scalar and vector quantities in motion
Interpret displacement-time and velocity-time graphs

cards.title: Calculus in Kinematics
details: Differentiate and integrate displacement, velocity, and acceleration with respect to time
Use equations of motion for constant acceleration

cards.title: Linear Momentum and Conservation
details: Use the definition and properties of linear momentum
Apply the conservation of linear momentum in collisions (including coalescence)

cards.title: Newton’s Laws in 1D Motion
details: Apply Newton’s laws to particles under constant forces
Understand tension, thrust, and resistance in connected particles

cards.title: Mass, Weight, and Forces on Planes
details: Use mass-weight relationship (W = mg)
Solve problems on horizontal and inclined planes with constant acceleration

cards.title: Work and Energy
details: Calculate work done by constant forces
Use gravitational potential energy and kinetic energy formulae

cards.title: Principles of Conservation and Power
details: Apply conservation of energy to mechanical systems
Use the definition of power, and relate work, force, and velocity
